sections.quest2: Does deco replaces my current commerce platform?
sections.quest5: How can I get more details on the platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx is a front-end-as-a-service platform that brings performance and personalization together to create exceptional e-commerce experiences. With built-in CMS, A/B testing, audience personalization, campaigns, and analytics, it's designed for both business users and developers.
questions.question: What is deco?

questions.answer: No, deco does not replace your current commerce platform. Instead, it serves as a headless frontend solution that seamlessly integrates with your existing platform, enhancing its performance and user experience.
questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx's tech stack is based on Deno, Preact, Tailwind, and Fresh. Deno is a secure JavaScript and TypeScript runtime. Preact is a React-compatible low-footprint component framework. Tailwind is a world-class functional CSS library that enables the creation of optimized styles for the web. Fresh is a modern server-side web framework built for Deno. Together, these technologies provide a powerful and secure foundation for creating high-performance and scalable storefronts.
questions.question: What tech stack does Deco use?

questions.answer: Deco leverages on cutting-edge technologies such as server-side rendering and global edge infrastructure to ensure fast website performance.
questions.question: How does Deco enable fast websites?

questions.answer: Deco's implementation process involves migrating the front-end implementation of an e-commerce store to Deco's tech stack. This migration can be carried out by one of Deco's partner agencies, an independent freelancer, or a developer within the client's own team. The duration of the implementation process typically ranges between 2 weeks and 2 months, depending on the complexity of the store.
questions.question: How is deco’s implementation process?

questions.answer: Join our community on Discord to learn more about deco.cx or get in touch with our sales team for more details.
questions.question: How can I get more details on the platform?

sections.quest2: Does deco replaces my current commerce platform?
sections.quest5: How can I get more details on the platform?

questions.answer: A deco.cx é uma plataforma moderna de desenvolvimento web que oferece uma stack de tecnologia simples e eficiente combinada com recursos poderosos para criar websites extremamente rápidos.
questions.question: O que é a deco.cx?

questions.answer: Não. Em vez disso, a deco.cx serve como uma solução de frontend "headless" que se integra perfeitamente às plataformas existentes, melhorando o desempenho e a experiência do usuário.
questions.question: A deco.cx substitui uma plataforma de ecommerce?

questions.answer: A stack da deco.cx é baseada em Deno, Twind e Fresh. Deno é um ambiente de execução seguro para JavaScript e TypeScript, enquanto Twind é uma biblioteca de CSS-in-JS que permite a criação de estilos otimizados para a web. Fresh é um framework web moderno para server side construído para Deno. Juntas, essas tecnologias fornecem uma base poderosa e segura para criar lojas virtuais escaláveis e de alto desempenho.
questions.question: Qual stack a deco.cx usa?

questions.answer: A deco.cx aproveita tecnologias de ponta, como renderização server side e infraestrutura global de edge, para garantir um desempenho rápido do site.
questions.question: Como é possível criar sites tão rápido com a deco.cx?

questions.answer: O processo de implementação da deco.cx envolve a migração da implementação frontend de uma loja de e-commerce para a stack de tecnologia da deco.cx. Essa migração pode ser realizada por uma das agências parceiras da deco.cx, uma pessoa dev freelancer ou uma pessoa dev dentro da própria equipe do cliente. A duração do processo de implementação geralmente varia entre 2 semanas e 2 meses, dependendo da complexidade da loja.
questions.question: Como é o processo de implementação de um site na deco.cx?

questions.answer: Junte-se à nossa comunidade no Discord para saber mais sobre a deco.cx ou entre em contato com nossa equipe de vendas para mais detalhes.
questions.question: Como posso obter mais detalhes sobre a plataforma?

sections.quest2: Does deco replaces my current commerce platform?
sections.quest5: How can I get more details on the platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx is a front-end-as-a-service platform that brings performance and personalization together to create exceptional e-commerce experiences. With built-in CMS, A/B testing, audience personalization, campaigns, and analytics, it's designed for both business users and developers.
questions.question: What is deco?

questions.answer: No, deco does not replace your current commerce platform. Instead, it serves as a headless frontend solution that seamlessly integrates with your existing platform, enhancing its performance and user experience.
questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx's tech stack is based on Deno, Twind, and Fresh. Deno is a secure JavaScript and TypeScript runtime, while Twind is a CSS-in-JS library that enables the creation of optimized styles for the web. Fresh is a modern server-side web framework built for Deno. Together, these technologies provide a powerful and secure foundation for creating high-performance and scalable storefronts.
questions.question: What tech stack does deco.cx use?

questions.answer: Deco.cx leverages on cutting-edge technologies such as server-side rendering and global edge infrastructure to ensure fast website performance.
questions.question: How does deco.cx enable fast websites?

questions.answer: Deco's implementation process involves migrating the front-end implementation of an e-commerce store to Deco's tech stack. This migration can be carried out by one of Deco's partner agencies, an independent freelancer, or a developer within the client's own team. The duration of the implementation process typically ranges between 2 weeks and 2 months, depending on the complexity of the store.
questions.question: How is deco’s implementation process?

questions.answer: Join our community on Discord to learn more about deco.cx or get in touch with our sales team for more details.
questions.question: How can I get more details on the platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx is a front-end-as-a-service platform that brings performance and personalization together to create exceptional e-commerce experiences. With built-in CMS, A/B testing, audience personalization, campaigns, and analytics, it's designed for both business users and developers.
questions.question: What is deco?

questions.answer: No, deco does not replace your current commerce platform. Instead, it serves as a headless frontend solution that seamlessly integrates with your existing platform, enhancing its performance and user experience.
questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx's tech stack is based on Deno, Preact, Tailwind, and Fresh. Deno is a secure JavaScript and TypeScript runtime. Preact is a React-compatible low-footprint component framework. Tailwind is a world-class functional CSS library that enables the creation of optimized styles for the web. Fresh is a modern server-side web framework built for Deno. Together, these technologies provide a powerful and secure foundation for creating high-performance and scalable storefronts.

questions.answer: Deco leverages on cutting-edge technologies such as server-side rendering and global edge infrastructure to ensure fast website performance.

This migration can be carried out by one of Deco's partner agencies, an independent freelancer, or a developer within the client's own team. The duration of the implementation process typically ranges between 2 weeks and 2 months, depending on the complexity of the store.

sections.quest2: Does deco replaces my current commerce platform?
sections.quest5: How can I get more details on the platform?

questions.answer: deco.cx é uma plataforma de front-end-as-a-service que junta performance e personalização para criar experiências de ecommerce excepcionais. Com um CMS integrado, teste A/B, audiências personalizadas, campanhas e analytics, ela foi projetada para ambos usuários de negócio e devs terem facilidade e agilidade na construção e otimização de lojas com conversão muito acima do esperado.
questions.question: O que é deco.cx?

questions.answer: Não, a deco.cx não substitui sua plataforma de ecommerce atual. Em vez disso, ela funciona como uma solução frontend headless que se integra perfeitamente à sua plataforma existente, melhorando seu desempenho e experiência do usuário.
questions.question: A deco.cx substitui minha plataforma de ecommerce atual?

questions.answer: A stack de tecnologia da deco.cx é baseada em Deno, Twind e Fresh. Deno é um runtime seguro de JavaScript e TypeScript, enquanto Twind é uma biblioteca CSS-in-JS que permite a criação de estilos otimizados para a web. Fresh é um moderno framework web server-side construído para Deno. Juntas, essas tecnologias fornecem uma base poderosa e segura para a criação de lojas virtuais de alto desempenho e escaláveis.
questions.question: Qual tecnologia deco.cx usa?

questions.answer: A deco.cx aproveita tecnologias de ponta, como renderização no lado do servidor e infraestrutura global de edge para garantir um desempenho rápido do website.
questions.question: Como a deco.cx possibilita websites rápidos?

questions.answer: O processo de implementação da deco.cx envolve a migração da implementação frontend de uma loja de e-commerce para a stack de tecnologia da deco.cx. Essa migração pode ser realizada por uma das agências parceiras da deco.cx, uma pessoa dev freelancer ou uma pessoa dev dentro da própria equipe do cliente. A duração do processo de implementação geralmente varia entre 2 semanas e 2 meses, dependendo da complexidade da loja.
questions.question: Qual é o processo de implementação da deco.cx?

questions.answer: Junte-se à nossa comunidade no Discord para saber mais sobre a deco.cx ou entre em contato com nossa equipe de vendas para mais detalhes.
questions.question: Como posso obter mais detalhes sobre a plataforma?

Brands - PT.title: Marcas líderes do ecommerce preferem a deco.cx

Deco CTA [EN].text: Own your frontend. Own your future.

questions.answer: Deco.cx is the frontend platform that bridges the gap between basic no-code site builders and complex full-code setups, allowing businesses of all sizes to create high-performance, fully personalized and AI-native web experiences. Our open-source platform bundles the best-in-class of framework, hosting, CMS, visual editor and code editor.
questions.question: What is deco.cx?

questions.answer: No, deco.cx acts as a complementary headless frontend layer for your existing commerce platform. It integrates seamlessly with any commerce platform that has open APIs, enhancing your store's development, performance and experience, without replacing your current system.
questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx uses Deno, Preact, Tailwind, and Fresh. Deno offers a secure runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript, while Preact is a lightweight, React-compatible framework. Tailwind facilitates optimized web styling, and Fresh is a modern server-side web framework designed for Deno.
questions.question: What tech stack does deco.cx use?

questions.answer: Deco.cx employs state-of-the-art techniques to deliver the smallest payloads with minimal latency. These techniques encompass server-side rendering, dynamic image resizing and encoding, server actions, an islands architecture, just-in-time CSS generation, and edge infrastructure spread across 35 regions, among many others.
questions.question: How does deco.cx ensure fast websites?

questions.answer: Yes, deco.cx can seamlessly integrate with a wide range of marketing tools and platforms, enabling you to streamline your marketing efforts and enhance customer engagement.
questions.question: Can deco.cx integrate with existing marketing tools?

questions.answer: Yes, deco.cx is built to support multi-language and multi-regional functionalities, making it an ideal solution for global ecommerce platforms seeking to provide localized experiences.
questions.question: Does deco.cx support multi-language and multi-region ecommerce sites?

questions.answer: deco.cx provides extensive developer support including: detailed documentation, a responsive community on Discord, and direct access to our technical team for guidance and troubleshooting.
questions.question: What kind of support does deco.cx offer for developers?

questions.answer: Absolutely! deco.cx is designed to scale with your business, whether you are a startup or a large enterprise.
questions.question: Is deco.cx suitable for businesses of all sizes?

questions.answer: For an in-depth understanding of deco.cx, join our community on Discord, read our documentation, or connect with our sales team.
questions.question: How can I learn more about deco.cx?

questions.answer: Implementing deco.cx involves migrating your ecommerce store's frontend to our tech stack. This can be efficiently executed by one of deco.cx's system integration partner agencies (SIs), an independent tech expert, or your in-house development team. The time frame varies from 2 weeks to 3 months, depending on your store's complexity. Access our deco Hub for a list of certified SI partners.
questions.question: What does the implementation process with deco.cx look like?

questions.answer: About 80% is already open source at deco-cx/deco (our engine) and deco-cx/apps (our integrations). We are working hard to provide a fully self-hosted and open source version in Q1 2024. Bear with us as we nail the final details that will allow for long term extensibility.
questions.question: Is deco.cx open-source?

questions.answer: Yes! Starting from 9 USD / mo you can add custom domains for unlimited sites (according to our free usage policy limits) and even invite collaborators to edit content.
questions.question: As a developer, can I host multiple customer projects in my personal team?

listContent.title: The High-Performance WebDev Opportunity
listContent.content: A brief history of the web, challenges, and a disruptive commitment to website creation.

listContent.title: Creating My First deco.site
listContent.content: The Deco architecture, creating and coding the first website, and the Deco settings admin.

listContent.title: The Basic Building Blocks: Sections and Loaders
listContent.content: Styling your website theme, configuring sections and loaders, segmenting content, and setting up apps.

listContent.title: From Zero To Hero: All You Need to Scale in One Tool
listContent.content: Continuous management and ongoing site management, through redirects, observability, and performance.

listContent.title: Mastering Sections: Reusable UI Components
listContent.content: Everything about sections. Properties and possibilities of using sections. Static files and changing the request status return from the section.

listContent.title: Mastering Tailwind: Never Write CSS Again
listContent.content: Mastering Tailwind: tokens, layout, utilities, and responsiveness.

listContent.title: Mastering Islands: (The least) Client-Side JavaScript is the Best.
listContent.content: When and how to use Islands. Hooks and manipulating state through signals.

listContent.title: Mastering Loaders: Connecting your Site to the Web
listContent.content: Fetching and providing data from loaders. Existing loaders. Use of context in the loader.

listContent.title: Advanced Loaders and Submitting Data with Actions
listContent.content: Invoking loaders, the existing loaders in Apps. Using actions to send data. Invoking loaders and actions from islands.

listContent.title: Mastering Routes, Matchers and Imports: This is the Way (of the Web)
listContent.content: Using third-party modules in your code. Understanding other blocks like routers, matchers, and handlers.

listContent.title: Massive Gains: Performance Debugging and Optimizing
listContent.content: The basic rules for thinking about performance. How to use the browser to debug issues and aspects of memory, performance, network, and security.

listContent.title: Lab Metrics vs User Metrics, How and When to Measure Performance
listContent.content: Understanding Deco own metrics, Lighthouse and each Core Web Vital metric and impact.

listContent.title: Optimize All the Things! Performance Tips for Loaders, Islands, Fonts and Images.
listContent.content: Optimization tips for using fonts, images, SVG, islands, and loaders.

listContent.title: Goodbye Client-side Templates: the Wonderful World of Server-Side Partial Rendering
listContent.content: CSS optimization, using deferred and async rendering, and optimizing third-party scripts.

listContent.title: Mastering SEO: Tailoring Your Digital Footprint
listContent.content: Customization of SEO, customizing page SEO, the use of structured data, and sitemaps.

listContent.title: Mastering Analytics and Tagging: Events Everywhere
Where Will You Take The Web?
listContent.content: Celebrate that you joined the Elite Web.

seo.title: Introducing deco.cx 2.0: A New Era for Frontend Development

en.descr: Typescript, Tailwind web editor with realtime collaboration, AI assistant, SEO configuration and much more. Check out deco.cx 2.0.
en.title: Introducing deco.cx 2.0: A New Era for Frontend Development
en.content:
Today marks the launch of **deco.cx 2.0**, an evolution of our platform built upon feedback from our community and a deep understanding of the challenges facing modern web developers. This release embodies our commitment to simplifying the development process while providing powerful, flexible tools that cater to both **developers and content creators.**

- [**New Navigation with Left Menu**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R4tr_xfsasJtP2NY5zJnYZipkrKxlipN/view): To streamline your workflow, we've introduced a new navigation schema. This redesign prioritizes quick access to frequently used features, enhancing productivity and reducing time spent searching for tools.

- [**Spaces and Windows**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qsA6eJOtfiYOLaRB508qM04Ah_3yitpJ/view): This feature introduces a more organized way to manage multiple tasks and edit different blocks simultaneously, significantly improving multitasking capabilities within the platform.

- [**Search and Command Bar**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EvnU-Y1QzLfiP8xJXpjezU12nkXr1RU-/view): A unified search and command interface allows for efficient navigation and action execution across your projects, directly addressing the need for speed in modern development environments.

- [**Code Editor and decopilot:**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/13IjKayZtQn-O5tDsgeD1Fq7NShN6gjfs/view?resourcekey) The integrated code editor and our new AI assistant, decopilot, are designed to streamline coding and creative processes. No need to clone a git repository to do a quick fix on a TypeScript file. Just code directly in the browser, assisted by our GPT-powered decopilot.

- [**Advanced SEO Configuration and Theme Customization**](https://deco.cx/advanced-seo-configuration-and-theme-customization-video): These enhancements offer deeper control over site optimization and branding, enabling developers to fine-tune their projects for better performance and coherence. Editing Tailwind themes has never been this fun.

- [**Release Diff and Staging Environment**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1A0D-cluBivK61hUVwaaPzhWFAG_8uT7k/view): With these features, deco.cx 2.0 addresses the entire development lifecycle, from initial creation to testing and deployment, ensuring that developers have the tools needed to deliver quality web experiences efficiently.

- [**Real-Time Collaboration**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SKsyznnv57hQdqGj4XmePWsFFuAdVvx7/view): Seeing teammates' avatars and changes in real time brings a new level of collaboration to your projects, reminiscent of the live collaboration seen in tools like Figma, but tailored for web development.

- [**Shortcuts**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mMk2ix2zVvwBGVfMKeTQ6zRne218FW5v/view): Keyboard shortcuts have been implemented to expedite common tasks, reflecting our understanding of the developer's preference for keyboard-driven interfaces.

- **Self Service Onboarding and Billing:** With direct access to onboarding and billing, we empower users to manage their experience autonomously, reflecting a shift towards self-service in software platforms.

- **Developer Profile and Blog:** By introducing developer profiles and improved blog management, deco.cx 2.0 fosters a community and enhances content management, recognizing the role of developers as both creators and contributors.

deco.cx 2.0 represents a significant leap forward in our mission to **simplify web development** while empowering developers with the tools they need to succeed in today's fast-paced digital landscape. Dive into deco.cx 2.0 and discover how these new features can **transform your development workflow.**
