sections.title: deco.cx - Case: A nova fase da Lojas Torra com a deco.cx
sections.description: Como a Lojas Torra dobrou sua taxa de conversão após migrar o front do seu ecommerce para a deco.cx

sections.title: A nova fase da Lojas Torra com a deco.cx
sections.author: Por Maria Cecilia Marques
sections.subtitle: Como a Lojas Torra dobrou sua taxa de conversão após migrar o front do seu ecommerce para a deco.cx

sections.text:
A Lojas Torra, referência do fast fashion no Brasil, enfrentava um desafio: seu e-commerce não estava à altura de seu legado.

Thiago Pereira, Diretor de Experiência Digital da Lojas Torra, conta que a empresa estava buscando maneiras de melhorar a experiência digital para seus clientes e, com isso, aumentar a taxa de conversão da loja online. Segundo ele, o padrão do setor estava bem acima do que a Lojas Torra estava alcançando no momento.

Impulsionados por seus parceiros da Agência e-plus, eles decidiram apostar na melhoria da performance do site como forma de impactar diretamente a experiência, usando a solução de frontend da deco.cx.
sections.label: Desafio

sections.role: CEO da Agência E-plus e força orientadora por trás do projeto
sections.quote: "100% dos nossos clientes estavam sofrendo com o baixo desempenho de seus ecommerces, e tudo o que fazíamos para melhorar resultava apenas em mudanças marginais. Foi quando conheci a deco.cx. É a maneira mais simples que conheço de obter todos os benefícios do headless, por uma fração do custo e tempo de implementação."
sections.author: Tiago Moraes

sections.text:
A decisão foi de migrar o front da loja sem alterações no layout. Dessa maneira, seria possível isolar as variáveis e medir o nível de sucesso da migração de ferramenta. Além disso, o projeto andaria mais rápido, já que não haveria investimento de tempo para um redesign.

O trabalho todo foi focado em reconstruir o site na deco.cx com a nova stack - Deno Fresh, Preact e Tailwind CSS - com blocos modulares, reaproveitáveis e facilmente customizáveis. Neste processo, a performace sempre foi um termômetro que indicava se o objetivo estava sendo cumprido.
sections.label: Migração

sections.text: Em apenas 45 dias, o e-commerce da Lojas Torra estava ao vivo na deco.cx. Sem nenhuma mudança de layout, a taxa de conversão saltou de 0,63% para 1,69%, estabilizando-se em 1,28%. Ou seja, a Torra DOBROU sua taxa de conversão apostando exclusivamente na performance do site! Além disso, as vendas cresceram 37% nas duas semanas após a migração.
sections.label: Resultados

sections.role: Diretor de Experiência Digital da Lojas Torra
sections.quote: "Esses resultados estão muito acima do que esperávamos. Na época, apostar na deco.cx, uma startup recém-nascida, foi uma decisão arriscada, até mesmo para minha carreira, mas se pagou no primeiro mês!"
sections.author: Thiago Pereira

sections.text:
Agora que a implementação está concluída, a equipe da Torra está usando o editor visual da deco.cx e as ferramentas de experimentação para evoluir seu site em um ritmo muito mais rápido. Mudanças que antes levavam mais de duas semanas para serem concluídas agora podem ser feitas em poucas horas e serem publicadas instantaneamente com total segurança.

Com tamanho sucesso alcançado, a meta agora é aumentar a conversão em mais 50%.
sections.label: Futuro

sections.quote: "Agora podemos desenvolver componentes e funcionalidades mais sofisticados que valem muito mais, enquanto a equipe de negócios da Torra usa essa biblioteca livremente para criar novas estratégias de conversão - é um negócio muito melhor para Agência e Varejista!"
sections.author: Gabriel Sampaio

features.title: Lightning-fast UI component library
features.subtitle: Speed up your building process. With our intuitive visual editor, embrace rapid design and deployment using pre-built, universally adaptable UI components.

features.title: Native design system builder
features.subtitle: Update your site's style in a snap. Easily tweak colors, button styles, and typography to create a distinct on-brand look with just a few clicks.

features.title: Realtime drag and drop site editor
features.subtitle: Business users and marketers can collaborate in realtime to create stunning digital experiences by reusing on-brand components with a no-code CMS.

features.title: Full code control in the browser
features.subtitle: Accelerate web development with deco.cx's integrated code editor made for Preact, Tailwind and Typescript. Edit directly in-browser, sync with any Git, and leverage our AI co-pilot for seamless coding.

features.title: TypeScript-first content modeling
features.subtitle: Our Type-based CMS is generated directly from your code, offering infinite possibilities for personalization with a smooth development experience.

features.title: One-click-install apps and integrations
features.subtitle: Enhance your site effortlessly through our deco Hub. Access a vast library of themes, apps, and templates that connect with any backend API.

features.title: Personalize your content for specific audiences
features.subtitle: Go beyond A/B testing. Create experiments, campaigns and targeted experiences backed by data-driven insights.

features.title: In-Depth Web Analytics & Observability
features.subtitle: Unlock advanced audience insights and comprehensive system observability for optimal performance.

value.title: 100% managed global edge infrastructure
value.description: Choose between self-hosting or using managed global edge infrastructure that deploys your code in 35 regions around the globe, ensuring the lowest server latency possible and auto-scaling as you grow.

value.title: How does deco.cx support SEO: insights from Gear SEO
value.author: By Maria Cecilia Marques
value.subtitle: Selecting the right ecommerce platform is crucial for SEO. Gear SEO's insights and a study show how deco.cx affect SEO implementation.

value.text: In the competitive realm of ecommerce, choosing the right platform has a significant impact on your SEO success. Gear SEO, a systems integrator (SI) agency with specialization in this field, recently highlighted key factors for selecting an ecommerce platform that enhances SEO effectiveness. Here's an overview of their insights, along with results from a study they conducted to test the feasibility and ease of implementing various SEO techniques across different platforms. We also added examples of how the different techniques have been applied by clients on deco.cx.

Original article in Portuguese written by Rodrigo Botinhão, CEO and Founder of Gear SEO:
https://gearseo.com.br/mercado/plataforma-de-e-commerce-para-seo/

English version of article:

1. Mobile responsiveness: A fast-loading, responsive site is non-negotiable. Any site created on deco.cx is 100% responsive by default.

Storefronts that migrate to deco.cx see an average 30% increase in PageSpeed and all have been approved by Goggle's Core Web Vitals standards.

1. WEBp image support: Reduces load times, benefiting SEO.
2. Tag and 3P code insertion: Efficient code handling can improve site load times.
3. lazy load
value.label: Crucial SEO elements in ecommerce platforms

value.text: 2. Customizable URLs: Essential for incorporating keywords. On deco.cx you have a fully customizable URL structure.

value.quote: "In BolsasJá we customized 100% of the Category and Subcategory URLs so that they all remained at the first level of URL navigation, increasing the relevance of other pages in relation to the home page."
value.author: Rodrigo Botinhão

value.text: 3. Integrated content: The blending of ecommerce and rich content is increasingly crucial. On deco.cx, brands can add text, images and videos (or any other HTML element) to their PDPs as well as build and manage blogs or any other satellite content.

Deco.cx's templates embrace accessibility and semantic HTML practices 

Built-in blogging on the main domain boosts SEO and deco.cx allows for both frontend and backend customization

4. Flexible collections and landing pages: Custom collections and landing pages aid in targeting long-tail keywords and capitalizing on organic traffic from pages with seasonal content.

Because on deco.cx you can create a new product collection on a customized URL that is not linked directly to the store's catalog tree or product menu, you can create seasonal content that is more likely to convert. The same concept applies to landing pages. The snip below shows Embelleze's special Black Friday LP with specific product shelves that are not necessarily associated with the main catalogue.

5. Editable meta elements: Control over meta descriptions and title tags is key.

On deco.cx you can personalize each meta element on your site - build the editor to go as granular as you need it to.

6. SEO-friendly frameworks: frameworks with appropriate support to guarantee that search engines can properly crawl and index all pages.

Deco.cx not only offers this kind of support, it also accurately handles custom filters and pages that appear on a site so that only the desired URLs are indexed by relevant search engines. 

For example, only option A is indexed by Google

A seusite.com.br/categorias/categoria-1
B seusite.com.br/categorias/categoria-1/?ordenacao=true&pagina=3

7. Product organization and availability: Addresses SEO impact of out-of-stock items. 

On deco.cx, when a product is out-of-stock and permanently removed from sale, instead of both product and URL being removes (leading all visitors to 404 error pages), you can not only redirect the URL to another similar URL or homepage, you can keep the original URL available and direct the visitor to similar products within your store. This practice allows the product to continue in organic searches and also continue bringing organic traffic into the site, guiding the visitor to a product close to what they were looking for.

8. Constant site availability: Essential for maintaining SEO rankings.

Deco.cx ensures 99.999% uptime!

Through their analysis, Gear SEO identified deco.cx as the platform that enables businesses to apply the highest number of technical recommendations while maintaining the lowest implementation complexity. As part of their study, Gear SEO launched the "SEO in practice" program, where they created a demo ecommerce applying all SEO fundamentals. Bolsas Já is a headless storefront that uses deco.cx's as a frontend platform and Shopify in the backend.
value.label: Deco.cx: a leader in SEO-focused ecommerce

value.text:
Headless flexibility and control: deco.cx's headless approach allows for creative and efficient SEO implementations, from mobile responsiveness to efficient handling of meta elements and content integration.

Integration capabilities: Seamlessly works with major ecommerce backends like Shopify.

Cost-effective development: Offers a flexible and specialized development environment, reducing costs and enhancing SEO focus.
value.label: Why choose deco.cx for your ecommerce?

value.text: In a landscape where no platform is perfect, deco.cx emerges as a frontrunner in meeting comprehensive SEO needs. Its design and functionalities align with the core SEO principles vital for ecommerce success.
value.label: Concluding Thoughts

value.text: Ready to Transform Your SEO?

# Jurídico deco.cx

Nosso time jurídico resguarda os interesses da deco.cx e assegura que todos os produtos, atividades e operações da empresa estejam em conformidade com as normas regulatórias, políticas internas e melhores práticas de mercado. Estamos comprometidos em minimizar riscos legais, prever desafios e resolver questões críticas de maneira eficaz e justa.

  

Nós cultivamos a integridade e entendemos a importância de estabelecer relações transparentes com nossos clientes e parceiros. Por isso, compilamos todos os nossos documentos e políticas em um único lugar de fácil acesso.

  

# Master Services Agreement

[deco.cx/msa-brasil](http://deco.cx/msa-brasil)

Este é o nosso contrato principal que delineia os termos e condições sob os quais prestamos nossos serviços. Aqui você encontrará informações sobre o escopo de nossos serviços, preços, condições de pagamento e outras diretrizes que regem nossa relação com você, nosso cliente.

  

# Master Partner Agreement

[deco.cx/mpa-brasil](http://deco.cx/mpa-brasil)

Se você é um parceiro ou está interessado em se tornar um, este é o documento que você precisa ler. Ele especifica como você pode se envolver na venda ou promoção de nossos serviços, e o que esperamos de você em troca.

  

# Política de Privacidade

[deco.cx/politica-privacidade](http://deco.cx/politica-privacidade)

Levamos a proteção de dados e a privacidade muito a sério. Este documento fornece detalhes sobre como coletamos, armazenamos e usamos dados pessoais. Estamos comprometidos em proteger sua privacidade e em cumprir com todas as leis e regulamentos vigentes.

  

# Termos de Uso

[deco.cx/termos-de-uso](http://deco.cx/termos-de-uso)

Estas são as regras do jogo. Ao usar nossos serviços, você concorda em cumprir com um conjunto específico de diretrizes e restrições. Este documento é crucial para garantir que nossa plataforma permaneça segura, eficaz e benéfica para todos os usuários.

  
Para qualquer dúvida ou consideração, não hesite em nos contatar pelo email [legal@deco.cx](mailto:legal@deco.cx).

# deco.cx Legal Team

Our legal team safeguards the interests of deco.cx and ensures that all the company's products, activities, and operations are in compliance with regulatory laws, internal policies, and best market practices. We are committed to minimizing legal risks, anticipating challenges, and resolving critical issues in an effective and fair manner.

  

We cultivate integrity and we understand the importance of establishing transparent relationships with our customers and partners. For this reason, we have compiled all our legal documents and policies in a single, easily accessible location.

  

# Master Services Agreement

[deco.cx/msa-us](http://deco.cx/msa-us)

This is our primary contract outlining the terms and conditions under which we provide our services. Here you'll find information about the scope of our services, pricing, payment conditions, and other guidelines that govern our relationship with you, our customer.

  

# Master Partner Agreement

[deco.cx/mpa-us](http://deco.cx/mpa-us)

If you're a partner or interested in becoming one, this is the document you'll need to read. It specifies how you can engage in selling or promoting our services and what we expect from you in return.

  

# Privacy Policy

[deco.cx/privacy-policy](http://deco.cx/privacy-policy)

We take data protection and privacy very seriously. This document provides details on how we collect, store, and use personal information. We are committed to protecting your privacy and complying with all current laws and regulations.

  

# Terms of Use

[deco.cx/terms-of-use](http://deco.cx/terms-of-use)

These are the rules of the game. By using our services, you agree to comply with a specific set of guidelines and restrictions. This document is essential for ensuring that our platform remains safe, effective, and beneficial for all users.

  
For any questions or concerns, please contact us at [legal@deco.cx](mailto:legal@deco.cx).

sections.title: deco.cx - Case: From creative vision to technical mastery: Zee.Dog's journey with deco.cx
sections.description: Discover how Zee.Dog regained control of its frontend operation to provide a best-of-breed web shopping experience

sections.title: From creative vision to technical mastery: Zee.Dog's journey with deco.cx
sections.author: By Maria Cecilia Marques
sections.subtitle: Discover how Zee.Dog regained control of its frontend operation to provide a best-of-breed web shopping experience

sections.text:
Zee.Dog, a beloved brand among pet owners with a presence in over 28 countries, has always been known for its design-first culture. But as they expanded, they faced challenges in maintaining their unique brand identity and delivering a seamless online shopping experience.

Despite their commitment to a one-of-a-kind website design, Zee.Dog's original ecommerce platform couldn't keep up with their vision. Customizations outside the platform's capabilities led to operational complexities and hindered site performance. The 2021 Black Friday campaign was a wake-up call. With page load times exceeding 10 seconds, frustrated customers couldn't complete purchases, leading to significant revenue loss.
sections.label: Challenge

sections.text: Discover Zee.Dog's full journey with deco.cx in our e-book!

Enter deco.cx. In October 2022, Zee.Dog's frontend tech lead, Eduardo Brito, saw the potential of deco.cx to revolutionize their online presence. He understood that deco.cx would guarantee a better development experience to Zee.Dog's team, while unlocking new ways to create unparalleled digital experiences. He also knew that the opportunity to pair program with deco.cx's senior engineers, develop a product together, and participate in a community focused on pioneer web development tools promised invaluable learning to his team.
sections.label: Solution

sections.quote: ”When we migrated to deco.cx, they didn’t have any off-the-shelf templates for ecommerce yet, and the team was still building its library of custom components optimized for performance. At the time, we knew that our site wouldn’t reach deco.cx’s gold standard of 90+ pagespeed, and we didn’t aim for that either: if we could reduce our site’s loading time by half that would be huge already. Beyond that though, I realized that the operational gains were so substantial that it was worth migrating to deco.cx’s stack even with an incomplete product.”
sections.author: Eduardo Brito

sections.text: The migration to deco.cx streamlined Zee.Dog's development process while increasing the autonomy of its marketing team to manage and evolve the ecommerce post go-live. Other than that, the website's average loading time dropped from 15 seconds to 2, and, although this wasn't the primary goal, the performance improvement led to a 30% increase in the site's conversion rate. Given that Zee.Dog's e-commerce already boasted an extraordinarily high conversion rate, this 30% increase was particularly significant. Lastly, not only were all of Zee.Dog's original customizations carefully preserved, several were also enhanced.
sections.label: Results

sections.quote: ”A couple of days after the go-live, I was looking at Hotjar — I tried to stop the 2x speed that I always had to use before deco.cx, but, to my surprise, it was ALREADY OFF. The site was super fast. That's when it became obvious to me that our performance had been killing our conversion.”
sections.author: Patrícia Silvério

sections.text: The successful migration of zeedog.com.br to deco.cx shows the direct correlation between performance and conversion. Encouraged by these results, Zee.Dog's team is now expanding its strategy to launch its express delivery service on deco.cx, and is also explroing the possibility of migrating the company's USA ecommerce.
sections.label: Future

sections.quote: ”With the results we are showing at this point, I believe that deco.cx will become the frontend solution used by the whole Petz Group.”
sections.author: Eduardo Brito

props.title:
High-Performance
Web Dev with deco.cx
props.subtitle: From Beginner to Expert: Master deco.cx for Elite Web and Storefront Development

props.title: Leading brands demand websites and digital storefronts that capture attention in milliseconds: fast and personalized experiences.
props.subtitle: ...Yet, the supply of developers equipped to deliver these needs lags far behind.

cardProblem.title: Slow Performance
cardProblem.content: Achieving near-instantaneous load times remains a demanding challenge, critical for user retention.

cardProblem.title: Hard to Personalize
cardProblem.content: Tailoring content to resonate with each visitor's unique preferences is a nuanced art few have mastered.

cardProblem.title: Poor Collaboration
cardProblem.content: Developers rarely build websites that enable marketing teams and other stakeholders to manage and update with ease.

cardProblem.title: Overwhelming Choices
cardProblem.content: Selecting the right stack from an ever-expanding arsenal is daunting yet essential for high-performance outcomes.

cardProblem.title: Skill Upgradation
cardProblem.content: Staying current with the evolving web development landscape is hard without a clear direction or mentorship.

cardProblem.title: Integration Overload
cardProblem.content: Merging various platforms and tools into a cohesive system is complex, often hindering developer productivity.

props.title: This masterclass is meticulously designed to bridge this gap.

topics.text: You'll launch top-tier websites and headless storefronts with unmatched speed.
You'll create scalable, highly personalized digital experiences.
You'll enhance team collaboration, simplifying site updates for non-dev roles.
You'll confidently manage live sites with deco.cx's robust monitoring suite.
You'll emerge as a forward-thinking developer, equipped for the web's evolution.
You'll expertly tackle and debug real-world project challenges.

props.subTitle: By the end of the course...

value.title:
Learn about the latest trends in

web development

cardWorks.title: Watch Pre-Recorded Video Classes
cardWorks.content: Every week day we will launch a new video (60 min long), you can watch by yourself or join our watch party at 6pm.

cardWorks.title: Do your Homework Exercises
cardWorks.content: Learn by doing. By the end of every video you will also get a suggestion of an exercise to help you consolidate your learnings.

cardWorks.title: Join Live Q&A Sessions With Mentors
cardWorks.content: Every weekday at 7pm we will have Q&A sessions with your mentors. We will review the exercises and help you with any questions.

cardWorks.title: Submit your Work and Become a Certified Partner
cardWorks.content: At the end of decoCamp, you can choose to submit the work done and get certified.

mentors.content: As the founding software engineer at deco.cx, Gaudencio has spearheaded educational initiatives and provided crucial support. Prior to this role, he served as a licensed computer science teacher at UFCG, where he took on responsibilities for chairs in web development and infrastructure. Additionally, Gaudencio led Public-Private Partnership (PPP) projects with industry giants like Lenovo and VTEX. With a decade-long tenure at UFCG, Matheus impacted the lives of over 1000 students.

Tiago is a software developer with a solid academic background, having graduated from Ecole Polytechnique in Paris and obtained a master's degree in Artificial Intelligence from HKUST. Over the past six years, he has dedicated his expertise to web development and optimizing frontend performance at leading ecommerce solutions. His journey reflects a commitment to staying updated with technological advances, enabling him to navigate the dynamic field of software development.

Luciano Júnior, a.k.a Lucis, has been coding since he was 7 and is passionate about creating simple solutions of make people's lives better. He is an advocate of the Web and has experience in building multi-tenant scalable applications, especially with his favorite language: Typescript. Lucis is also passionate about education, having mentored and lectured in his area since his college degree in Computer Science at UFCG. He follows the mantra "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication".

Héricles is a software engineer dedicated to enhancing user experiences through UI/UX development, styling, and web animations. Grounded in a solid foundation from UFCG, he infuses his work with a blend of technical expertise and creative innovation. Over the past few years, he has also been actively involved in contributing to and maintaining open-source projects across various computer science fields while remaining committed to crafting visually captivating designs that not only meet functional needs but also inspire and delight users.

Guilherme Rodrigues, co-founder and CEO of Deco.cx, is a distinguished software engineer with a robust background in computer science from PUC-Rio. His innovative work includes pioneering one of Brazil's first taxi apps and making significant contributions to the growth of VTEX, enhancing e-commerce across Latin America. Guilherme is dedicated to nurturing the next wave of tech talent, using his extensive experience to foster innovation and drive excellence in web development.

Viktor is a software developer with a passion for crafting innovative solutions to complex problems. Commited to continuous learning and improvement, he is dedicated to staying abreast of the latest technologies and industry trends, always seeking opportunities to apply those cutting-edge tools to real-world problems.

questions.answer: Deco.cx is a front-end-as-a-service platform that brings performance and personalization together to create exceptional e-commerce experiences. With built-in CMS, A/B testing, audience personalization, campaigns, and analytics, it's designed for both business users and developers.
questions.question: What is deco?

questions.answer: No, deco does not replace your current commerce platform. Instead, it serves as a headless frontend solution that seamlessly integrates with your existing platform, enhancing its performance and user experience.
questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx's tech stack is based on Deno, Preact, Tailwind, and Fresh. Deno is a secure JavaScript and TypeScript runtime. Preact is a React-compatible low-footprint component framework. Tailwind is a world-class functional CSS library that enables the creation of optimized styles for the web. Fresh is a modern server-side web framework built for Deno. Together, these technologies provide a powerful and secure foundation for creating high-performance and scalable storefronts.
questions.question: What tech stack does Deco use?

questions.answer: Deco leverages on cutting-edge technologies such as server-side rendering and global edge infrastructure to ensure fast website performance.
questions.question: How does Deco enable fast websites?

questions.answer: Deco's implementation process involves migrating the front-end implementation of an e-commerce store to Deco's tech stack. This migration can be carried out by one of Deco's partner agencies, an independent freelancer, or a developer within the client's own team. The duration of the implementation process typically ranges between 2 weeks and 2 months, depending on the complexity of the store.
questions.question: How is deco’s implementation process?

questions.answer: Join our community on Discord to learn more about deco.cx or get in touch with our sales team for more details.
questions.question: How can I get more details on the platform?

description: Introdução - Treinamento comercial deco.cx - Sites ecommerce de alta performance
---
# Introdução
<iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VE5nMTjjrAY?si=crWkoeICA6ax14Ii" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

**E aí, pessoal, tudo bem?**

Sejam bem vindos ao primeiro treinamento comercial da deco.cx para as nossas
agências parceiras. Sou Rafael! Se você não me conhece, pode me chamar de Baby.
Todo mundo me conhece como Baby. Eu sou co-fundador da deco.cx, junto com Lucis
e com o Gui, e vai ser um prazer participar dessa jornada aqui junto com vocês.
A gente montou esse conteúdo para que você tenha em um só lugar tudo o que você
precisa para você prospectar novos clientes, ou para você entender quais são
exatamente os principais benefícios da deco.cx.

A ideia é que você ganhe muito dinheiro com a gente. Que você cresça seu
portfólio, que você deixe seus clientes mais felizes. E a gente vai mostrar tim
tim por tim tim como que você vai fazer isso. A gente pensou tudo com muito
carinho. Mas é claro que isso aqui é só uma primeira versão. Então, se você
tiver qualquer tipo de feedback a contribuir, você vai vir aqui em algum lugar
dessa tela, um QR Code, um link.

Por favor, contribua, mande feedbacks. A gente vai interagir continuamente. A
ideia é que esse conteúdo evolua e a gente lance novas versões desse material de
tempos em tempos. Tudo pronto? Pega o caderninho, pega uma caneta, pega um copo
d'água ou uma cerveja e vamos começar.

description: Treinamento Comercial deco.cx - Diagnóstico inicial.
---
# Diagnóstico inicial
<iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-jaFIqxavQc?si=4cfM6-Q7u367JgZS" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Então pessoal, vamos para o primeiro exercício. Nessa tela vai aparecer um
[link](https://forms.gle/pze9zpHrZTJEt42d9) onde você abre um formulário e você
responde rapidinho quatro perguntas. A principal vantagem de você participar
desse exercício é que depois que você responde, você tem acesso as respostas de
todas as outras agências. E tudo isso é anônimo. Então você pode ficar muito
tranquilo que não vai aparecer quem respondeu não vai aparecer agência que
respondeu mas você vai ter uma ferramenta de benchmarking. Você vai conseguir
analisar como os seus concorrentes estão pensando, onde eles estão posicionados,
sem oferecer nenhuma informação sigilosa pra ninguém.

A primeira pergunta é: **O que você espera desse treinamento?** O que você
espera conquistar no final desse treinamento?

A segunda pergunta é: **Quais são as queixas dos seus clientes atuais?** Do que
os seus clientes estão reclamando? O que estão te pedindo?

A terceira pergunta é: **O que você tem feito enquanto agência para resolver
essas dores dos seus clientes?**

E a última pergunta é: **Como que você espera que a deco.cx ajude a sua agência
a resolver suas próprias dores e ajude os seus clientes a resolverem as dores
deles?**

questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx's tech stack is based on Deno, Preact, Tailwind, and Fresh. Deno is a secure JavaScript and TypeScript runtime. Preact is a React-compatible low-footprint component framework. Tailwind is a world-class functional CSS library that enables the creation of optimized styles for the web. Fresh is a modern server-side web framework built for Deno. Together, these technologies provide a powerful and secure foundation for creating high-performance and scalable storefronts.
questions.question: What tech stack does Deco use?

questions.answer: Deco leverages on cutting-edge technologies such as server-side rendering and global edge infrastructure to ensure fast website performance.
questions.question: How does Deco enable fast websites?

questions.answer: Deco's implementation process involves migrating the front-end implementation of an e-commerce store to Deco's tech stack. This migration can be carried out by one of Deco's partner agencies, an independent freelancer, or a developer within the client's own team. The duration of the implementation process typically ranges between 2 weeks and 2 months, depending on the complexity of the store.
questions.question: How is deco’s implementation process?

questions.answer: Join our community on Discord to learn more about deco.cx or get in touch with our sales team for more details.

sections.title: Why We Web — deco.cx
sections.description: A manifesto for simpler webdev tools.

sections.title: Why We Web
paragraphs: We built the web with audacious ambitions: to wire the world, to             connect every human mind, to accelerate progress. But, as we             advanced, web development got tangled in complexity. What was once             straightforward now feels like navigating a maze of frameworks and             services, making it harder for new voices and ideas to emerge.

The need to simplify is urgent. Web development shouldn't feel like             a boring puzzle. It should be easy and fun. It should be scalable             and observable by default. It should be realtime and collaborative.             It should give anyone the autonomy to test new ideas and evolve             without fear of "breaking". And it should just work.

With AI, TypeScript, modern browsers, fast runtimes, and affordable             edge infrastructure, the web is ready for a breakthrough. This is an             invitation for the contrarians, the doers, the ones eager to make             their mark: it’s time to cut through the clutter, to build the             simpler tools we deserve. It's time to "get site done."

posts.descr: Checklist for a smooth shopping season
posts.title: Black Friday 2023
posts.author: Tiago Gimenes
posts.content:
Black Friday is just around the corner, and it's an incredible opportunity for online businesses to boost their sales. To help you make the most of this shopping period, we've compiled a list of essential tasks to ensure that your online store is fully prepared for Black Friday 2023.

## Adopt Ahead-of-Time Builds

Fresh recently introduced an innovative feature called "ahead of time builds," designed to transform how you create and deliver your website. This approach not only stabilizes your store's JavaScript but also significantly improves server boot times. To fully understand this new approach, you can explore the structured documentation provided by Fresh [here](https://fresh.deno.dev/docs/concepts/ahead-of-time-builds).

At [Deco.cx](http://deco.cx/), we strongly recommend adopting the ahead-of-time version because it provides scalability to your server, which is essential for handling the demands of events like Black Friday. To migrate to this new version, instruct your developer to perform the update using the following command:

```sh
deno run -Ar https://deco.cx/upgrade
```

After> completing the update, make sure that:

1. Your store is functioning correctly, including checking the home, product detail (PDP), and product listing (PLP) pages, as well as verifying the add-to-cart functionality and any other critical flows.
2. Administrative editing is working smoothly, allowing you to edit your store's sections and publish them.

If your store is already online, the [Deco.cx](http://deco.cx/) team has already run this command for you. To verify, ask your developer to look for a Pull Request (PR) on GitHub with the title "Preparations for Black Friday." If you encounter any issues during this process, don't hesitate to contact us on [Deco.cx Discord](https://deco.cx/discord).

## Support for Mobile Safari

A few months ago, we shared a blog post detailing the [lessons we've learned](https://www.deco.cx/en/blog/licoes-6-meses.md) from our stores in production. We strongly recommend implementing all the suggestions mentioned in the post before Black Friday. However, one of the most critical steps is to ensure that your store functions seamlessly on Safari versions 12, 13, and 14.

To achieve this, follow these steps:

1. Verify that your `fresh.config.ts` file includes the Safari12 build target.
2. Ensure that your website does not use the `<dialog>` tag.

Engage your developer to make the necessary adjustments to remove the `<dialog>` tag and set Safari12 as the build target. We recommend performing this step after migrating to ahead-of-time builds to ensure a smooth transition.

As we kick off the holiday shopping season, the [Deco.cx](http://deco.cx/) team is dedicated to providing stability and reliability during this critical period. Starting this week, we will be actively working on stability improvements to enhance your experience on Black Friday. It's crucial to stay up-to-date with the latest Deco versions and keep an eye out for more informative posts on how to optimize your online store for success on Black Friday.

posts.title: deco play
posts.author: Héricles Emanuel
posts.content:
## deco play

Making life easier for developers is at deco's core, and today we're proud to announce deco play, a new way to test our stack in record time!

To start testing deco play, go to [https://play.deco.cx](https://play.deco.cx) and follow the instructions.

![deco play](https://github.com/deco-sites/std/assets/18706156/ec92362b-9d18-42d8-9c60-bcb5bfef0d71)

It's the fastest way to spin up a deco site or app on your local machine and start developing with Preact, Tailwind, Deno and getting all the benefits of our CMS that automatically extracts the schema from your functions (UI components, loaders, actions…), makes them easily editable and composable on a Web UI that saves the data locally.

And you don't need to be logged into [deco.cx](http://deco.cx) to use deco play, it's just one click away from the command line!

seo.title: New Analytics Tool
seo.description: Analytics with realtime, goals and conversions!

posts.descr: Analytics with realtime, goals and conversions!
posts.title: New Analytics Tool
posts.author: Matheus Gaudencio and Nathan Luiz
posts.content:
## Introduction

Following up on [Updated Redirects configuration](https://www.deco.cx/en/blog/redirects.md), **we're releasing today the new analytics tool**. We comprehend the significance of tracking every step of website users, from their first access to the site, to viewing a product, completing a purchase, and more. That's why we have evolved our tool!

## Analytics on deco

We understand that data collection tools can impact the platform's performance. For this reason, deco uses a tool that seeks to strike a balance between performance and the collection of essential data needed for the analysis of various website usage metrics.

In addition to a smaller and more efficient data collector, we also have some exciting updates with the new tool!

### Better UI/UX

Our new, user-friendly and visually appealing analytics tool provides metrics such as location, device, operating system, and bounce rate, making it a more enjoyable experience.

![Plausible](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/882438/277673611-ea99f749-5b43-45dd-b7f6-43834c2dd638.png)

### Realtime Analytics

![Realtime Dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/882438/277673679-5d85bc68-f166-4958-8d35-d3a33a77a716.png)

See your current visitors in real-time. No more waiting two days for data.

### Goals and Funnels

![Funnels Dashboard](https://github.com/deco-cx/apps/assets/882438/28f4312a-b259-4ae2-9b4c-2f484432fe2d)

It's also possible to see at which point in the purchasing journey the user decides to interrupt the process. This can happen during the initial page view, immediately after adding a product to the cart, or even during the checkout!

## Analytics Apps

[You can view the code that powers Deco Analytics](https://github.com/deco-cx/apps/tree/main/analytics), and even make contributions!

To use this tool, you need to update the **deco-cx/apps** to version 0.17.3 or higher.

In the coming days, we will commence the roll-out to our production customers. That's it for today. Keep an eye out for our next release!

seo.title: Redirects
seo.description: Create and manage Redirects on deco.cx

posts.title: Redirects
posts.author: Igor Brasileiro
posts.content:
Today, we're excited to introduce a new feature that allows our users to
**manage redirects on their websites directly** on deco.cx's Admin. Now, users
can create, edit and delete redirects without any extra effort.

You can test this feature right now by accessing the admin panel at
[https://admin.deco.cx](https://admin.deco.cx/).

![Creating a new redirect](https://github.com/deco-sites/std/assets/15680320/19144393-6dc7-4e26-8243-c952c99fbca1)

## Types of Redirect

When it comes to creating redirects, you have two options: temporary or
permanent.

- **Temporary**: not indexed, stored or cached by crawlers (e.g: Google) and
  browsers. They provide a short-term solution and are ideal for situations
  where you might want to reroute traffic temporarily.

- **Permanent**: stored by search engines and crawlers. They permanently update
  the path for the current page, and they are hard to undo. If you're unsure
  about which type of redirect to choose, we strongly recommend using temporary
  redirects.

### **Enabling this Feature for Your Site**

For websites created after the date of this blog post (Oct 23 2023), this
feature will be enabled by default.

If your site was created before this blog post, you can enable this feature by
updating your site dependencies to `deco@1.41.11` and `apps@0.15.8`. (Run
`deno task update`) Next, update your app's **`site`** by adding a new Site Map
entry named `Redirects`. Once this is done, all managed redirects will function
seamlessly on your site.

![Editing a redirect](https://github.com/deco-sites/std/assets/18706156/ab3d9567-cb1f-444d-9d77-35f810f1cacc)

If you have any questions, feel free to reach us at
[deco.cx Discord Server](https://deco.cx/discord).

That's all for today. Stay tuned for our next release!

seo.title: New Editor
seo.description: Easier to use, refreshed UI, and better JSON editing

posts.descr: Easier to use, refreshed UI, and better JSON editing
posts.title: New Editor
posts.author: Lucis and the deco.cx team
posts.content: ## New Editor Following up on our [Admin Reloaded](https://www.deco.cx/en/blog/admin-reloaded.md), we're **releasing today the new CMS editor.** This release includes a redesigned layout based on feedback from our users, an emphasis on content segmentation, and a new inline JSON editor. You can test it right now by accessing the admin via https://admin.deco.cx. ## New Layout The editor now sits on the left sidebar and it comes with a simpler UI, without compromises. The dynamic form, which varies based on the current block, takes more of the screen's width and its refined inputs provide a better editing experience. ## Publish instantly The action bar on the top of the editor was also simplified. Only one click is necessary to publish content, and secondary actions (like creating a draft of splitting traffic) are available in the submenus. ## Developer Mode Power users are very important to deco and now they get their own mode in the CMS. Developer Mode provides a powerful JSON editor with IDE-like features and instant data validation. Toggle it on the top-right of the sidebar. ## Drafts and Variants To better suit work-in-progress content, Drafts can now be created directly from the top bar and they stay listed on the Variants portion of the editor. This allows sharing the URL so coworkers can preview the block with changes that were made. Variants, which are used to segment content to different audiences, are now first-class citizens in the editor and it's easier than ever to, for example, create a different page setup for Mobile users. From the Publish button it's possible to split traffic between the current and new versions That's it for today. Keep an eye out for our next release.

posts.title: Admin Reloaded
posts.author: Guilherme and the deco.cx team
posts.content: ## Welcome to the New Admin Beta and the Start of October Launch Month Hey Deco users, we have something new for you! Today, we’re excited to introduce the beta version of our revamped admin panel, **available now at [https://admin.deco.cx](https://admin.deco.cx/).** Let’s get straight into what’s new and what you can expect in the coming weeks. ## 1. New Navigation and Topbar Menus Switching teams is now hassle-free. Do it straight from the topbar, no need to return to the home page. Access team members and billing options instantly, and with the new integrated menu, Pages, Sections, and Analytics are just a click away. ## 2. New Site Home We’ve made it simpler and more intuitive, focusing on a clean design that puts your site and important info front and center. ## 3. New Admin Pages ## Sections Your new Visual Library is here. Easily edit and create headers, footers, banners, and more with the available components. ## Apps Manage all your installed apps and their settings in one place. And keep an eye out - we’re rolling out improvements throughout the month. ## Deployments Track deno deploy versions, and roll back with ease. Every new commit is displayed, making version management a breeze. ## Logs Access logs from any deployment, filter by date, and pinpoint errors quickly and accurately. Never guess what's happening in production again! ## Coming Up in October Launch Month We’re not stopping here. Every week, we’re rolling out new features leading up to the official launch of the new admin panel on October 31st, coinciding with our Fourth Hackathon. Here’s a sneak peek: * End-to-end New Analytics and VTEX Funnel * A new editor with full variant support and enhanced publishing * Easy redirects and proxies setup * SEO updates and simplified new site creation * Quick start on [play.deco.cx](https://play.deco.cx/) * Unified release history and easy version restoring with GH + Deco integration * A comprehensive library of ecommerce components * One-click app installations from Deco hub ## Final Words The beta version of the new admin is live, and we’re eager to hear your feedback. Explore, test, and let us know your thoughts in the **#admin-feedback** channel on our [deco.cx Discord server](https://deco.cx/discord). Note that you can continue using the stable version at https://deco.cx/admin. Stay tuned for weekly updates, and get ready for the official launch on October 31st. See you soon! Happy coding! _The deco.cx team_

posts.title: 6 meses de lojas em produçāo
posts.author: Gui Tavano, Tiago Gimenes
posts.content:
Nos últimos seis meses acumulamos um valioso conjunto de lições ao levar lojas para produção. Nesse período, aprendemos o que deve ser evitado, o que não funciona e a melhor maneira de iniciar o desenvolvimento de uma loja online. A seguir, compartilhamos um resumo das lições que adquirimos durante essa jornada. ## Início do Desenvolvimento de uma Loja Todos projetos criados na Deco partem de um template pré-configurado com diversos componentes, integrações e temas. Observamos que, após criar a loja, alguns desenvolvedores recorrem ao GitHub para modificar componentes e temas diretamente no código. Embora isso seja um reflexo natural do trabalho de um desenvolvedor, notamos que os projetos nos quais o desenvolvimento se concentra principalmente no CMS (Content Management System) tendem a ser concluídos mais rapidamente e com melhor desempenho. O fluxo que descobrimos ser o ideal é o seguinte: 1. Criar o projeto. 2. Personalizar o tema, componentes, otimização de SEO, entre outros através do admin da deco. 3. Apresentar o resultado ao cliente final e coletar feedback. 4. Com base no feedback, ajustar a loja no CMS, usando as seções predefinidas e voltar ao passo 3. 6. Se o cliente estiver satisfeito, migrar o domínio para a Deco. 7. Caso seja necessário fazer alterações no código, adicionar seções específicas para o caso de uso em questão. ## A Tag `` Em versões anteriores de nossos templates, utilizávamos a tag HTML5 ``. Essa tag permitia a criação de modais com suporte à acessibilidade. No entanto, identificamos dois problemas principais relacionados a ela: 1. Exigia JavaScript para funcionar corretamente, o que ia de encontro à nossa filosofia de minimizar o uso de JavaScript na página. 2. Versões recentes do iPhone (10, 11 e 12) não oferecem suporte a essa tag, o que nos forçava a inserir "polyfills". Essa inserção era síncrona e prejudicava significativamente o desempenho dos sites. Devido a esses dois pontos mencionados, adotamos uma abordagem alternativa usando a tag `` para evitar incompatibilidades com iPhones. Para obter mais informações sobre essa abordagem, consulte [este link](https://daisyui.com/components/modal/#method-2-using-a-hidden-checkbox-legacy). ## Unidades absolutas Percebemos que algumas de nossas lojas apresentavam taxas de conversão abaixo do esperado em determinados dispositivos, especialmente em iPhones e dispositivos Android. Após uma análise mais aprofundada, identificamos que o botão "Ir para o checkout" estava sendo ocultado pela barra de endereços dos navegadores Chrome e Safari em alguns desses dispositivos. Esse problema ocorreu devido ao uso de unidades absolutas, como `vh` (viewport height) e `vw` (viewport width), em vez de unidades relativas. As unidades absolutas fazem referência ao tamanho total da tela do dispositivo, não levando em consideração a área de renderização da janela, o que pode ocultar partes da interface do usuário. Para evitar esse tipo de problema, é fundamental evitar o uso de unidades absolutas, como `vh` e `vw`. Recomendamos revisar sua loja para garantir que essas unidades não estejam sendo usadas, especialmente no minicart. ## Flexbox e Unidades Percentuais Outro problema que identificamos em algumas lojas diz respeito ao layout quebrado em versões mais antigas do Safari. Isso ocorre geralmente quando unidades percentuais são usadas em conjunto com flexbox. Um exemplo disso é o seguinte trecho de código: ```html
``` Nesse exemplo, estamos combinando flexbox (classe `flex`) com unidades percentuais (`width: 100%`). Isso pode funcionar em navegadores mais recentes, mas causa problemas em versões mais antigas do Safari, como o iPhone 10, 11 e 12. Para solucionar esse problema, recomendamos substituir `w-full` por classes relacionadas ao flexbox: ```html
``` Isso garantirá que o layout funcione corretamente em todos os navegadores. Estamos sempre acompanhando os novos projetos, coletando os apresentados e melhorando o template [Storefront](https://github.com/deco-sites/storefront).

posts.title: Partials
posts.author: Marcos Candeia, Tiago Gimenes
posts.content:
[Fresh](https://fresh.deno.dev/), o framework web utilizado pela Deco, é conhecido por possibilitar a criação de páginas de altíssimo desempenho. Uma das razões pelas quais as páginas criadas na Deco são tão eficientes é devido à arquitetura de ilhas. Essa arquitetura permite que os desenvolvedores removam partes não interativas do pacote final de JavaScript, reduzindo a quantidade total de JavaScript na página e aliviando o navegador para realizar outras tarefas.

No entanto, uma das limitações dessa arquitetura é que páginas muito complexas, com muita interatividade e, portanto, muitas ilhas, ainda exigem uma grande quantidade de JavaScript. Felizmente, essa limitação agora é coisa do passado, graças à introdução dos Partials.

## Como Funciona?

Os Partials, inspirados no [htmx](https://htmx.org/docs/), operam com um runtime que intercepta as interações do usuário com elementos de botão, âncora e formulário. Essas interações são enviadas para nosso servidor, que calcula o novo estado da página e responde ao navegador. O navegador recebe o novo estado da IU em HTML puro, que é então processado e as diferenças são aplicadas, alterando a página para o seu estado final. Para obter informações mais detalhadas sobre os Partials, consulte a [documentação](https://github.com/denoland/fresh/issues/1609) do Fresh.

## Partials em Ação

Estamos migrando os componentes da loja da Deco para a nova solução de Partials. Até o momento, migramos o seletor de SKU, que pode ser visualizado em ação [aqui](http://storefront-vtex.deco.site/camisa-masculina-xadrez-sun-e-azul/p?skuId=120). Mais mudanças, como `infinite scroll` e melhorias nos filtros, estão por vir.

Outra funcionalidade desbloqueada é a possibilidade de criar dobras na página. As páginas de comércio eletrônico geralmente são longas e contêm muitos elementos. Os navegadores costumam enfrentar problemas quando há muitos elementos no HTML. Para lidar com isso, foi inventada a técnica de dobra.

A ideia básica dessa técnica é dividir o conteúdo da página em duas partes: o conteúdo acima e o conteúdo abaixo da dobra. O conteúdo acima da dobra é carregado na primeira solicitação ao servidor. O conteúdo abaixo da dobra é carregado assim que a primeira solicitação é concluída. Esse tipo de funcionalidade costumava ser difícil de implementar em arquiteturas mais antigas. Felizmente, embutimos essa lógica em uma nova seção chamada `Deferred`. Esta seção aceita uma lista de seções como parâmetro que devem ter seu carregamento adiado para um momento posterior.

Para usar essa nova seção:

1. Acesse o painel de administração da Deco e adicione a seção `Rendering > Deferred` à sua página.
2. Mova as seções que deseja adiar para a seção `Deferred`.
3. Salve e publique a página.
4. Pronto! As seções agora estão adiadas sem a necessidade de alterar o código!

Veja `Deferred` em ação neste [link](https://storefront-vtex.deco.site/home-partial).

> Observe que, para a seção `Deferred` aparecer, você deve estar na versão mais recente do `fresh`, `apps` e deco!

Uma pergunta que você pode estar se fazendo agora é: Como escolher as seções que devo incluir no deferred? Para isso, use a aba de desempenho e comece pelas seções mais pesadas que oferecem o maior retorno!

Para mais informações, veja nossas [docs](https://www.deco.cx/docs/en/developing/partial)
